intro: Bupleurum falcatum f. schimperianum, commonly known as the Schimper's milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically white to pale yellow, and it produces small, ribbed fruits. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments.
